page.title: 09HOME LIFE IN WEST BRADFORD
page.content: The delivery of fresh milk produced locally begins the day in our area.We are woken by alarm clocks in homes generally warmed by central heating. Some cottages have open fires which are made first thing using matches,paper, sticks and coal.Breakfast consists of fruit juice,porridge or cereal;fried, poached or scrambled eggs and bacon, toast and marmalade with tea,coffee or milk.Washing up is done either by hand or in a dishwasher.Houses are cleaned using vacuum cleaners for carp- ets.Glass or ceramic or wood surfaces are washed by hand using water and detergent.Clothing is washed in electr- ic washers and dried in driers or hung out in the garden to dry naturally. Ironing is done by hand.Dinner,a hot meal,may be taken at mid-day or in the evening.It is usually prepared in the home and includes soup and bread.
